item.title: GenSan fish port to be locked down starting Sept 2
item.description: The General Santos City Fish Port Complex will be locked down starting Wednesday-September 2 to Tuesday-September 8.

item.title: Zambales reports 55 new COVID-19 cases, total at 324
item.description: Zambales on Saturday reported 55 new coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) cases, according to Saleema Refran s report on “24 Oras News Alert.”

item.title: PNP COVID-19 cases exceed 4,000 with 103 new infections
item.description: The number of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) cases within the Philippine National Police (PNP) surpassed 4,000 on Saturday with 103 new infections, bringing the total tally to 4,004.

item.title: Catanduanes students camp out for data signals, online classes
item.description: When online classes began on August 10, a hill in Virac, Catanduanes became the temporary classroom of several students amid the coronavirus disease 2019 pandemic.

item.title: Duterte may announce new PhilHealth head by Monday -Go
item.description: President Rodrigo Duterte could announce Ricardo Morales' replacement as Philippine Health Insurance Corporation president and CEO by Monday-August 31, Senator Christopher "Bong" Go said on Saturday.

item.title: Pampanga seeks probe on conflicting COVID-19 test results
item.description: The Pampanga provincial government called for an investigation to determine why COVID-19 swab tests from private laboratories had contradictory results to swab tests from government labs.

item.title: Japan, US defense chiefs oppose bid to alter status of Asian waters
item.description: Japan's Defence Minister Taro Kono said on Saturday he had agreed with his US counterpart Mark Esper that both countries opposed any unilateral attempt to change the status quo in the key waterways of the South China Sea and the East China Sea.

item.title: COVID-19 isolation at treatment facility sa Candelaria, Quezon, bubuksan sa Lunes
item.description: Isang isolation at treatment facility ang nakatakdang buksan sa Candelaria, Quezon sa Lunes upang labanan ang patuloy na pagtaas ng kaso ng COVID-19 sa bayan.

item.title: Bulacan Governor Daniel Fernando tests positive for COVID-19
item.description: Bulacan Governor Daniel Fernando announced on Saturday that he tested positive for the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19).

item.title: Bato: Unfair to relieve entire Jolo PNP over soldier deaths, bombings
item.description: Senator Ronald “Bato” Dela Rosa on Saturday said it was unfair to relieve the entire Philippine National Police force in Jolo, Sulu after a shooting incident and twin blasts that killed almost 20 people.

item.title: PCOO on late Archbishop Oscar Cruz: May his lessons bring optimism during pandemic
item.description: The Presidential Communications Operations Office on Saturday (PCOO) joined the Catholic community in mourning the passing of Lingayen-Dagupan Archbishop Emeritus Oscar Cruz.

item.title: PAWS files animal cruelty complaint vs Manila City Pound officials
item.description: The Philippine Animal Welfare Society (PAWS) filed an animal cruelty complaint against officials of the Manila City Pound for allegedly cramming 60 cats into a 2 x3 foot cage and subjecting the animals to starvation and dehydration.

item.title: PCOO saddened by Japanese PM Abe's resignation due to illness
item.description: The Presidential Communications Operations Office (PCOO) on Saturday said it was "saddened" to hear that Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe had resigned due to poor health.

item.title: PCCI urges stronger Balik Probinsya efforts amid COVID-19
item.description: The Philippine Chamber of Commerce and Industry (PCCI) on Saturday said that efforts on the Balik Probinsya Program should be intensified as high population density became the major cause of the spread of the coronavirus disease 2019.

item.title: Sinovac's COVID-19 vaccine candidate approved for emergency use in China -source
item.description: Sinovac Biotech Ltd's coronavirus vaccine candidate CoronaVac was approved for emergency use as part of a programme initiated in July in China to vaccinate high-risk groups such as medical staff, a person familiar with the matter said.
